intro: Carlowrightia californica var. pallida, commonly known as the pale California buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the buckwheat family, Polygonaceae, and is characterized by its showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral, and it has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features include small, oval seeds and a preference for well-drained soils, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
